subject_terms_3: Portrait photography Marriage customs Heritage and Culture Children
physical_appearance: The image shows a rectangular colour photograph. The surrounding frame has patterns all over its body. The photograph depicts a Peranakan wedding. It features a four people, comprising of a man, a woman, and two children. The adults are standing in the middle, separating the two children. All of them are dressed in the Peranakan ethnic costumes and have makeup on. They are standing on a carpet, in the interior of a building. The surrounding consists of potted plants, photographic frames, and furniture.
sgcool_label_text:
This photograph shows a Peranakan bride and groom in an interior of a house, accompanied by a pageboy and bridesmaid.  

Photographs were sometimes painted, usually by an artist who first applied Chinese ink or oil paint to the negative before further working on the print. With the advent of colour negative film in the 1950s, hand-tinted photographs fell out of vogue.
subject_terms_1: studio portraits group portraits weddings (ceremonies) children (people by age group) ethnic groups Peranakan
